node.title: Shopping for Champagne Glasses
node.alt: Fun, inexpensive glasses are ideal for casual get-togethers. (A pair of Bodum Oktett glass-and-plastic flutes is $22 at MoMA design store.)
node.description: Itâ€™s almost time to raise a glass to the new year. What kind of glass should it be?
node.content: ["The holidays offer plenty of reasons to pop some bubbly, including reuniting with family and friends and toasting the new year. But when you raise a glass, make sure it\u2019s a good one.", "\u201cA glass has an influence on a wine,\u201d said Aldo Sohm, a sommelier and the wine director at Le Bernardin and Aldo Sohm Wine Bar in New York, and a brand ambassador for the upscale glassware company Zalto. \u201cIt\u2019s a bit like music, when you have one song and listen from two different speaker systems \u2014 it makes that huge difference.\u201d", "Champagne glasses come in a range of shapes, from flutes to coupes, and some have colors and decorations. Fortunately, there are no wrong choices. Fun, inexpensive glasses may be ideal for casual get-togethers with midrange wines. A special bottle, however, may be best appreciated with special glassware.", "\u201cYou can drink out of a paper cup, which costs five cents, or you can drink out of a Zalto champagne glass, which costs $60. The question is: What are you looking for?\u201d Mr. Sohm said.", "At the end of the day, he added, \u201cThe best glass is the one you want to drink out of.\u201d", "Engraved champagne flute based on a design owned by Thomas Jefferson", "Pair of glasses in smoke gray or pink", "Pair of champagne flutes with faceted form by Erdem Akan", "Angular German crystal champagne flute", "Pair of champagne flutes with plastic bases and glass tops"]
